contextId.information: Putting an object into someone's hand is a metaphor for allowing that person to do what he wants with that object. Here the reader should understand that Cyrus expected Mithredath to do what Cyrus wanted him to do. AT: "put Mithredath the treasurer in charge of them" or "made Mithredath the treasurer responsible for them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: put them into the hand of Mithredath the treasurer

contextId.information: Standing up is a metaphor for beginning to act. AT: "began to act and built" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Separating themselves from uncleanness represents refusing to do things that make people unclean. AT: "They refused to do the things that the people of the land did that made them unclean" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: separated themselves from the uncleanness of the people of the land

contextId.information: Seeking Yahweh represents choosing to know, worship, and obey him. AT: "chose to obey Yahweh" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

Strengthening their hands in the work represents helping them to work. The Assyrian king did this by telling them to do the work and providing the money for it. AT: "to help them do the work of his house" or "to make it possible for them to do the work of his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: to strengthen their hands in the work of his house

contextId.information: Establishing his heart represents firmly deciding or committing himself to do something. AT: "Ezra committed his life to study" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: Ezra had established his heart to study

contextId.information: Placing things in the king's heart represents causing him to have certain thoughts and desires. AT: "caused the king to want to glorify Yahweh's house in Jerusalem" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: placed all this into the king's heart to glorify Yahweh's house in Jerusalem

contextId.information: Being strengthened represents being encouraged. AT: I am encouraged" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])

The word "seek" represents asking God to do something for them. Here a "straight path" represents safety while they travel. AT: "to ask God to give us, our little ones, and all our possessions safety while we travel" or "to ask God to protect us, our little ones, and all our possessions while we travel" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: to seek a straight path from him for us, our little ones, and all our possessions

contextId.information: The writer speaks of God allowing the kings to do whatever they wanted to do to the Jews as if God had put small objects into the hands of the kings of this world. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: into the hand of kings of this world

contextId.information: God deciding to be merciful is spoken of as if mercy were a person who could move. AT: "Yahweh our God has decided to be merciful to us and" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: mercy from Yahweh our God has come

contextId.information: Covenant faithfulness is spoken of as if it were an object that someone could hold in his hand and hold out for another person to take. AT: "has offered to be faithful to us and keep his covenant" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: has extended covenant faithfulness to us

contextId.information: The wall that keeps people safe is a metaphor for Yahweh protecting his people. AT: "could keep us safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: could give us a wall of safety
